item.title: Abstaining from alcohol heightens dementia risk?
item.description:
www.standard.co.uk
People who drink more than the recommended alcohol limit and those who are teetotal are at a heightened risk of dementia, a new study suggests. Scientists examined data on more than 9,000 people who took part in the survey, which tracked the health of civil servants working in London. Abstinence was found to be associated with a staggering 45 per cent higher risk of dementia compared to those who consumed between one and 14 unites of alcohol a week.

item.title: ALASKA AIRLINES panned after gay couple had to give up seats...
item.description:
www.sfgate.com
SEATTLE (AP) - Alaska Airlines faces outrage from people on social media after a gay couple had to give up seats on a New York City-Los Angeles flight to make room for a straight couple. The Seattle Times reports the couple accepted an apology Tuesday from the airline, which said there was a seating mistake not reflective of disrespect in Sunday's incident. David Cooley said he and his traveling companion were in their assigned seats when a gate agent asked his companion to give up his seat and move so another couple could sit together. Coley, owner of a popular upscale gay bar in the West Hollywood section of Los Angeles, recounted the incident in posts on Facebook and Twitter.
